ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: 1. Over your lifetime, did you have any accident?
Notes: This includes taking too much of your medication accidentally

ElementDescription: 1a. How seriously did you plan or intend to hurt yourself in any accident (either passively or actively)?
Notes: 0= Not at all;1= A little;2= Moderately;3= Very;4= Extremely

ElementDescription: 1b. Did you intend to die as a result of any accident?
2. Over your lifetime, how seriously did you think that you would be better off dead or wish you were dead?
Notes: 0= Not at all;1= A little;2= Moderately;3= Very;4= Extremely

ElementDescription: 3. Over your lifetime, how seriously did you think about harming yourself or hurting or injuring yourself, with at least some intent or awareness that you might die as a result or think about suicide (killing yourself)?
Notes: 0= Not at all;1= A little;2= Moderately;3= Very;4= Extremely

ElementDescription: 4. Over your lifetime, how seriously did you have a suicide method in mind (i.e. how)?
Notes: 0= Not at all;1= A little;2= Moderately;3= Very;4= Extremely

ElementDescription: 5. Over your lifetime, how seriously did you have a suicide plan in mind (i.e. when or where)?
Notes: 0= Not at all;1= A little;2= Moderately;3= Very;4= Extremely

ElementDescription: 6. Over your lifetime, how seriously did you intend to act on thoughts of killing yourself?
Notes: 0= Not at all;1= A little;2= Moderately;3= Very;4= Extremely

ElementDescription: 7. Over your lifetime, how seriously did you intend to die as a result of a suicidal act?
Notes: 0= Not at all;1= A little;2= Moderately;3= Very;4= Extremely

ElementDescription: 8. Over your lifetime, how seriously did you take active steps to prepare for a suicide attempt in which you expected or intended to die  (This includes times when you were going to kill yourself, but were interrupted or stopped yourself, before harming yourself)?
Notes: 0= Not at all;1= A little;2= Moderately;3= Very;4= Extremely

ElementDescription: 9. Over your lifetime, how seriously did you injure yourself on purpose without intending to kill yourself?
Notes: 0= Not at all;1= A little;2= Moderately;3= Very;4= Extremely

ElementDescription: 10. Over your lifetime, how seriously did you attempt suicide ("A suicide attempt is a potentially self-injurious behavior, with at least some intent (>0) to die as a result or if intent can be inferred, e.g. if it is clearly not an accident or the individual thinks the act could be lethal, even though denying intent")?
Notes: 0= Not at all;1= A little;2= Moderately;3= Very;4= Extremely

ElementDescription: 11. Over your lifetime, how many times did you attempt suicide?

ElementDescription: 12. Over your lifetime, how many times did you take active steps to PREPARE for a suicide attempt in which you expected or intended to die?
Notes: (Do not count the times connected to an actual suicide attempt)
date
0= Not at all;1= A little;2= Moderately;3= Very;4= Extremely

Sum the number of times recorded for questions 2 and 3

ElementDescription: 14. Fatal, but not enough information to code as completed suicide?
15. Known death from causes other than suicide?
16. Subject alive, but not available because of suicide attempt?
17. Subject alive, but not available, for reasons other than suicide, or for uncertain reasons, or lost to follow up?

Notes: Add questions 1a + 2 through 10 + 13 + 16
